newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Thirdliners liven up sluggish Philippine bourse.
newsitem.headline: Thirdliners liven up sluggish Philippine bourse.

text.p: Thirdliners took charge in early trading at the Philippine Stock Exchange as local investors snapped them up in lieu of the slow-moving blue chips and major secondliners, brokers said.
"They're alive again. They've been resurrected," Julie Ann Villena, an analyst at Magnum International Securities Inc, said.
She said local investors, for lack of impetus to take a long-term position in a very tentative market, decided to play the penny stocks for short-term gains.
"People are trying to recoup their losses in recent weeks," Villena added.

Leading the thirdliners were newly-converted holding firms Atok Big Wedge A which jumped 65 centavos or 24.53 percent to 3.3 pesos and Acoje Holdings which gained two centavos or 13.89 percent to 21 centavos.

Other big movers includeed oil explorer Pacifica Inc A which went up 13.04 percent or 0.75 centavos to 6.50 centavos and mining firm Itogon Suyoc Mines Inc which gained 2.25 centavos to 25.71 percent to 11 centavos.
Michelle Bautista, an investment analyst at Asian Capital Equities, said the trend is typical of a short-term technical rally.
"In a technical rally like this, it's usually the thirdliners which are the first to go off," she said.
Bautista said the even if blue chips have already reached their oversold levels, earning potentials were still in doubt following the release of unimpressive first quarter financial results.
